name: TheAtlantic
text: How Kayleigh McEnany, an ardent defender of faith—and Donald Trump—came to think of the press as her enemy. @EmmaOGreen on the White House press secretary: https://t.co/hBmyv7gBE1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We are public servants. We should reflect the populations we represent. That’s the way you get the best ideas," @marydalyecon tells @AnnieLowrey: https://t.co/vcJeyhWmuN

name: TheAtlantic
text: HBO’s darker, edgier “Perry Mason” remake is strongest when it remembers what was so potent about the original character. @sophieGG on the curse of TV reinvention: https://t.co/9OXdzS8ymW

text: Once again, this pandemic is at risk of spiraling out of control. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/2VfU3TKqRn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers may have captured, for the first time, the flare from a faraway cosmic collision of two black holes, @marinakoren reports. https://t.co/0wOBcHnL1r

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Chinese Exclusion Cases have never been overruled, which is what allowed the Court to rely on the ideas they expressed. As long as these cases remain good precedent, administrations will be tempted to embrace them," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/ub3aCsRDMF
